website_summaries.verdict: The V-Trail is a minimalist off-road shoe that is suitable for runners and racers who are relatively experienced in barefoot running. It is designed to handle rough trails, including slush and muck that is usually brought about by winter conditions. The structure of this shoe is made to withstand tough use by adventurous wearers.
pros: Many users thought the Vibram FiveFingers V-Trail was extremely comfortable and breathable
One reviewer was amazed that the shoe provided a tight and secure grip on slick surfaces
Several runners agreed that it felt great on the foot and it fit them comfortably well
The shoe was durable enough and did not show any signs of wear even after many months of usage, according to a user
It provided a subtle amount of cushioning that was just right for a five-fingered shoe, as stated by a reviewer
One buyer mentioned the shoe helped relieve their pain from walking
A majority of runners claimed there was adequate protection from the shoe against sharp rocks and roots
A couple of runners said the shoe was comfortable enough to be worn without socks
A reviewer said the V-Trail allowed them a more efficient running experience and has brought less strain on the knees compared to ordinary running shoes
cons: A number of users found that the colors of the shoe bled and stained their sock and foot
The shoe needed quite a long time to break in, as observed by a couple of runners
Some buyers said that the shoe felt tight and narrow
The heel bed was narrow and the toe part caused abrasions, according to one user
One reviewer pointed out that the shoe was not easy to put on or take off because of its unique foot-shaped design

customer_reviews.title: Worth it if you're serious.
customer_reviews.text: Vibrams are great for building up foot strength but it is not an every run shoe. Toe socks are a pain, but clammy vibrant are nightmare to get on. I use them as a training aid more than a training shoe, if that makes sense. Great for lifting in the gym. Much better balance on on deadlifts, alt sqauts, standing presses etc.
customer_reviews.author: Mongan

customer_reviews.title: I bought these for bare foot type running but now use for hiking
customer_reviews.text: Nice shoes, expensive for what they are but they seem to be wearing well. I found they did aggravate my Achilles tendon a bit if I walk too far. The aching is from an older injury but it seems to come back more often if I wear these a lot
customer_reviews.author: Martin S

customer_reviews.title: Keep you on your toes...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect barefoot trail shoes for forefoot running. Good grip, hold well on the foot and the material is lightweight and well-designed.
customer_reviews.author: Richard the Taijigerheart

customer_reviews.title: Futureshoe
customer_reviews.text: my first time with the trail running 5fingers. remarkable grip. great feel. I have an EU size smaller than usual, because I like the snug fit for the toes. my one concern is my big toes are wide and protrude on the outside edge of each toe... I wonder if this will lead to holes in the toe fabric before I'm ready for them?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: These are my second pair of V Trails. They fitted exactly as the old pair. Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Belinda

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: My 5 pair and my 2nd pair of this model. The best I've worn even my old KMD ones.
customer_reviews.author: Primal/Paleo Man

customer_reviews.title: Great trail trainers for bare footers, but wear out too quickly.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic trail trainers for barefoot runners. You feel everything, but it doesn't hurt kind of experience. They won't slip off, but do wear down too quickly though😢
customer_reviews.author: AEvan

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Good, I have a few vibram five fingers now and they have got better over the years. This pair is probably the best yet. The fit comes up a little bigger than I was expecting but will wear some slightly thicker socks through the winter. I would recommend these though I do think vibram over price!
customer_reviews.author: Nick Woods

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I am a size 8.5. I went for 8/8.5 and these fitted perfectly. Branded packaging, well constructed and delivered on time. Excellent all over.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin O. Stickland

customer_reviews.title: Pay close attention to the numbering
customer_reviews.text: I live in another country, so I asked a friend to bring the model for me. Wanted the size M42 but for being English, the numbering table was not clear. I received the M41 which got small to wear with socks.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo Alvim Silva

customer_reviews.title: Love running in the fivefingers.
customer_reviews.text: I've been running in the fivefingers for a couple of years now and I no longer get the knee and hip pains that I was previously experiencing after a run.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent

customer_reviews.title: comfort is meh
customer_reviews.text: NOT a very premium product for the price, and not hat comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Paulo lopes

customer_reviews.title: to large for the specified size
customer_reviews.text: I am a large 13 UK size but these where much bigger than the size 13/14 more like 15/16
customer_reviews.author: Duncan lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Great for long runs and challenging terrain
customer_reviews.text: If you are a regular vff wearer then you might think that these are cheating, given their slightly thicker soles, but on very long runs and on very challenging terrain they are spot on. I did my first ultra (47 miles of trails) in them, having done most of the training in KSOs, and had a great race. Many things hurt afterwards but my feet were not amongst them. (If you are not a regular vff wearer then I would recommend a very careful transition over a long period of time in much thinner soled vffs, such as KSOs, which are much closer to the barefoot experience.)
customer_reviews.author: Graham

customer_reviews.title: I'm a chiropractor and it's very important to keep your posture in a good shape. So if you have good shoes
customer_reviews.text: Hi. I'm a chiropractor and it's very important to keep your posture in a good shape. So if you have good shoes, you help yourself. Lot of shoes are yo high or too low for our body. Vibram is very good shoes. Confit and support your foot. Good quality, with vivobarefoot and xeroshoes, they are the best . Delivery ok. No pb. If you are a runner, you need to get use first so be careful.
customer_reviews.author: Flo

customer_reviews.title: Fiancé is happy
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my fiancé’s birthday, I know nothing about them but according to him:- “They’re so sturdy, my feet don’t hurt walking on pebbles like my other Vibrams, they let my feet breathe and when I’m training I feel I have a sturdy foundation”
customer_reviews.author: Beatrice

customer_reviews.title: these are amazing. the fit was a little larger than it ...
customer_reviews.text: these are amazing. the fit was a little larger than it should be but that does not cause any discomfort. i have tested it hiking in rough terrain that have no trails climbing mountains and after a long day my feet feel like they have been working out. its quite strange as we never really exercise these muscles with normal shoes. also no more pain in the knees after long hikes. i love them.
customer_reviews.author: Karolis Tiknius

product_meta.title: Vibram FiveFingers Men's V Trail Running Shoes
product_meta.description: A technical shoe for trail runners and mud racers, the V-Trail is an ideal off-road minimalist shoe
feature_bullets: Unparalleled grip on wet and dry surfaces
